sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: More solidarity among EU member states in managing migratory pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: That's the goal of the European Parliament after approving on Thursday three key proposals on migration that aim to end the years-long standoff between EU member states on how to deal with the issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The principle of the so-called Dublin Regulation, which means that every asylum seeker coming to Europe should present their request in the country of first entry, remains valid, but with more exceptions like the family or educational ties of migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: but with more exceptions like the family or educational ties of migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: According to MEPs, though, solidarity between EU countries should be expressed in different ways.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, it's binding to make sure that every member state contributes, but then what we offer from the European Parliament is that we should have flexible options, that we will see some member states that will work with relocation, others might work with capacity building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And this is because we want to open up the deadlock that we have seen for years, because something needs to happen now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The vote by MEPs establishes the European Parliament's stance in negotiations on the issue with the EU Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: If the Parliament gets its way, physical relocations would still apply under normal circumstances, but would become binding when a member state calls it a crisis situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Commission would then have to assess the crisis request and, if confirmed, set quotas of migrants to be deployed to the other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Solidarity may have a chance. Solidarity when it comes to emergency crisis situations. That's precisely the point of this regulation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: emergency crisis situations. That's precisely the point of this regulation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Mandatory relocation is a key point for Mediterranean countries like Italy, which has this year seen a 300% increase of migrants by sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The system of voluntary relocations, which is currently in place, has not worked well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Despite several thousand pledges, only a few hundred people have so far been transferred from Italy to other member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Negotiations between the Parliament and Council are unlikely to be easy given the years of tension. The main goal of the negotiation with the Council is that instead of putting forward the mechanisms of solidarity between member states, member states in the reception and integration, we privilege the security approach that will increase detention and accelerate return procedures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: EU governments will push hard for the aspects related to the external dimension of migration, like the screening of migrants at borders and leverage that can be used against countries of origin for their return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: They're protesting the cost of living crisis and demanding pay increases for nights, weekends and public holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: German rail and transport union EVG has also called for a strike on Friday, which is expected to last from 3 to 11 a.m.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A new UNICEF study shows people's trust in vaccinating children is falling around the world, and the decline has been accentuated by the COVID-19 pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Trust in childhood vaccines remains highest in India, but people in Papua New Guinea and South Korea are most sceptical.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Europe, Portugal has the highest reliance on childhood vaccination. Russia is the most skeptical.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The pandemic had a huge impact on public perception of vaccines, largely due to strong anti-vaccine campaigns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The report indicates that between 2019 and 2021, 67 million children received no or only some vaccines, with significant numbers unprotected against measles and HPV.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: UNICEF stresses the importance of early years vaccination and says each euro invested has a 26 times greater return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vaccines help to save 4.4 million lives annually, and this could rise to 5.8 million by 2030.
